newsitem.title: CHINA: China auditors net 203.8 billion yuan in 1996.
newsitem.headline: China auditors net 203.8 billion yuan in 1996.

text.p: China's auditing departments seized 203.8 billion yuan ($24.55 billion) in illegal funds or money that violated financial regulations in 1996, a figure up by more than 100 percent compared with 1995, the China News Service said on Wednesday.
The auditing departments reviewed 178,000 government units last year, the newspaper said.

The most serious problems were found in departments responsible for selling the rights to use of state-owned land, with more than 67.7 billion yuan-worth of illegal funds found in this sector, it said.

Another 7.0 billion yuan in funds was found in audits of the Bank of China, China Construction Bank, Agricultural Bank of China and China International Trust and Investment Co and their subsidiaries, it said.
